text: Pope Innocent X (; 6 May 1574 â€“ 7 January 1655), born Giovanni Battista Pamphilj, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church and the 237th Pope from 1644 to 1655. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-12-1. ==Early life== Pamphilij was born in Rome in 1574. "Pope Innocent X", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-12-1. He was a great-great- great-grandson of Pope Alexander VIWoodward, William Harrison. (1914). Cesare Borgia: a Biography, p. 388. He graduated from the Collegio Romano before entering a career in the church. ==Cardinal == In 1629, he was raised to the rank of Cardinal. ==Pope== Cardinal Pamphilij was elected pope in 1644; and he chose to be called Innocent X. ==Related pages == * List of popes * List of popes from the Borgia family ==References== ==Other websites== * * Catholic Hierarchy, Pope Innocent X * Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Cardinal Pamphilj Category:Italian popes Category:People from Rome Category:1574 births Category:1655 deaths Category:House of Borgia
title: Pope Innocent X
